availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jones Finnell (Estill County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky, native. Married to Mary "Polly" Stone Finnell in Estill County, Kentucky, on December 28, 1841. Father of Susan Finnell, John Finnell, Catharine Finnell, Elizabeth Finnell, Louisa Finnell, Simpson Finnell, Fountain Finnell, and Jones Finnell. Farmer in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Estill County in 1860. Held eight enslaved persons in trust for [Unknown] Finnell in Estill County in 1860. Purchased Clayborne Finnell in Clark County on December 22, 1862. Owned Clayborne Finnell in Estill County from December 22, 1862, to October 25, 1864. Farmer in Estill County in 1863. Owned Jo [Unknown] in Estill County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 37B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 126.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 400B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Forks Precinct, p. 515B.
Compiled Military Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in United States Colored Troops: 56th-138th USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA RG 94, Roll RG94-USCT-124-Bx13.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Estill County, KY, July 1863, p. 53.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994033, Estill County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Estill County Marriages, Film 000254628.
Lyndon Comstock, Before Abolition: African-Americans in Early Clark County, (Lexington, KY: Lyndon Comstock, 2017), pp. 639-640.
